DOC.detailed_description: The aim study assess comparative effect three regimen administration magnesium sulfate use care woman severe pre-eclampsia . The study include 240 pregnant woman present casualty unit criterion severe preeclampsia form one criterion : - - Systolic blood pressure ≥ 160 . - Diastolic blood pressure ≥ 110 . - Proteinuria > +2 dip stick . - Presence alarming symptom ( headache , visual disturbance , epigastric pain , vaginal bleeding ) . - Fetal growth restriction ( IUGR ) . After obtain informed consent patient subject follow : - Careful history take include age , parity , gestational age . - Complete physical examination assessment blood pressure . - Urine analysis dipstick . - All woman take initial MgSO4 ( 6 gram MgSO4 250 ml ringer solution 20 minute IV drip ) . Using Random Number Table , sample size divide three category : - - Category A : 80 patient give full dose maintenance MgSO4 ( 4 gram MgSO4 250 ml ringer solution 4 hour every 4 hour IV drip 24 hour ) postpartum period . - Category B : 80 patient give abbreviated dos MgSO4 ( 4 gram MgSO4 250 ml ringer solution 4 hour every 4 hour IV drip 12 hour ) postpartum period . - Category C : 80 patient take load dose MgSO4 ( 6 gram MgSO4 250 ml ringer solution 20 minute ) postpartum maintenance sulfate . Inclusion criterion : - Pregnant female ≥20 week gestation . - Pregnant female criterion severe pre-eclampsia . - Single multi-fetal pregnancy . - Primigravida Multigravida . Exclusion criterion : - Pregnant female < 20 week gestation . - Pregnant female history epilepsy . - Pregnant female diabetes . - Pregnant female chronic hypertension . - Pregnant female renal disease .
